javadoc:
SignatureCallback provides a Callback implementation used to perform PKI authentication. This callback is instantiated by the server with a random token which must be signed using the user's certificate which contains one of the recognizedAuthorities within it certificate chain.

It is the responsibility of the callback handler to invoke the sign(X509Certificate[], byte[]) and return this object in response to the callback.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Construct callback with a random token to be signed by the client.

params.name: recognizedAuthorities
params.comment:
list of CA's from which one must occur
 within the certificate chain of the signing certificate.

methods.javadoc: Returns list of approved certificate authorities.
methods.name: getRecognizedAuthorities
methods.comment: Returns list of approved certificate authorities.

methods.javadoc: Returns token to be signed using user certificate.
methods.name: getToken
methods.comment: Returns token to be signed using user certificate.

methods.javadoc: Returns signed token bytes set by callback handler.
methods.name: getSignature
methods.comment: Returns signed token bytes set by callback handler.

methods.javadoc: Returns the server's signature of the token bytes.
methods.name: getServerSignature
methods.comment: Returns the server's signature of the token bytes.

methods.javadoc: Returns certificate chain used to sign token.
methods.name: getCertificateChain
methods.comment: Returns certificate chain used to sign token.

methods.name: sign
methods.comment:
Set token signature data.  Method must be invoked by 
 callback handler.

params.name: sigCertChain
params.comment: certificate chain used to sign token.
